meanings.definition: A cylindrical carbon molecule with a hollow structure, also known as a carbon nanotube.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the buckytube under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Carbon nanotubes are often referred to as buckytubes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the buckytube refuse to share electrons? It was too shellfish!
meanings.sent4: The buckytube stood tall among the carbon structures, like a skyscraper in a city of molecules.
meanings.sent5: In the world of tiny structures, the buckytube shone like a beacon of innovation.

meanings.definition: To form into a tube-like structure resembling a buckytube.
meanings.sent1: She carefully buckytubed the carbon atoms to create a nanotube.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to buckytube the metal wire into a unique shape.
meanings.sent3: Why did the carbon atoms want to learn how to buckytube? They heard it was a twisty adventure!
meanings.sent4: His creativity knew no bounds as he buckytubed the material into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: With skilled hands, she buckytubed the elements into a masterpiece of design.
